name: Ryan Rana
title: Software Engineer & AI Enthusiast
bio: i pip installed Python turtle in 2020; now i'm interested in solving problems with agents[1], VLMs[4], robots[5] & scalable systems[6].
currently cs @ Rutgers[9] & building software for robots @ 3e8. previously co-founded [Mesh](https://www.joinmesh.today/)[10] & engineered @ [Centren Health](https://centrenhealth.com/)[11].
I also built a lot of other cool [software](https://github.com/RyanRana) over many domains in the past 6 years[12].

when Claude[13] can't debug my slop, i like to [write](https://ryanranas.medium.com/)[14], ski[15], [craft](pages/wood.html) & eat Chipotle[16]. i'm always seeking geniune collobaration and connection.

references.title: agents
references.description: built multi-step agent systems with memory, iterative feedback, rag & domain-specific constraints like Osler[2] for hospitalists, Aura[3] for enterprise.

references.title: Osler
references.description: hospitalist agent that handles onboarding and live workflow. adapts to all types of data and tools, runs under real hospital rules.

references.title: Aura
references.description: internal enterprise agent platform that interacts with Snowflake. modular agents, shared toolbelt, composable workflows.

references.title: VLMs
references.description: been studying mainly for robotics[5] but also confidential surveillance assignments (looking to meet others working).

references.title: robots
references.description: studying deformables, not just sim. Also doing generative serial chains as a side project (looking to meet others working).

references.title: scalable systems
references.description: must know skill. I practice this in all work.

references.title: technical depth
references.description: learn things from the ground up. reason from first principles.

references.title: high agency
references.description: operate without blanket instructions, learn by building.

references.title: cs @ Rutgers
references.description: in 2nd year, taking physics, discrete II, and principles of programming language, this semester, yet most skills come from outside class.

references.title: Mesh
references.description: internal ai knowledge system for teams; reached 600 users.
